intro: Tetracera indica, commonly known as the Indian tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and can grow as a shrub or small tree. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
